p: To characterize the cells, present in the skin before wounding (unwounded skin), or during the inflammatory phase (3 rd day after wounding) and the proliferative phase (10 days), markers for neutrophils (CD45 +Ly6G +), M1 macrophages (CD45 +F4/80 +CD11c +), M2 macrophages (CD45 +F4/80 +CD206 +), T helper lymphocytes (CD45 +TCRb +CD4 +) and T cytotoxic lymphocytes (CD45 +TCRb +CD8 +) were used. The gating strategy is shown in Supplemental Fig.Â 2A,B.
